entry.title: Combined summary - Update on "Speedy" Trial
entry.summary: The Speedy Trial proposal, which aims to expedite changes to the Bitcoin network, is the topic of an email sent by an author to the Bitcoin-dev mailing list. The timeline for the proposal is outlined, with a community meeting held in February establishing consensus that BIP 9 was "dead" in favor of BIP 8. In March, Russell O'Connor proposed "Speedy Trial" as a way to move forward quickly with no clear consensus on the LOT parameter in BIP 8. As of April, two open pull requests in Bitcoin Core exist for implementing Speedy Trial, but limited opposition to using block height has prevented any progress from being made. The author suggests that if this situation persists, it may be necessary to restart discussions about a user-activated soft fork. Overall, the update provides insight into the ongoing efforts to improve and streamline the Bitcoin network through the development of proposals such as Speedy Trial.
